div.sent: God loves all human beings.
He loves all the animals, trees, plants and everything around us.
But why? Because, He Himself is a symbol of goodness.
Besides, He Himself has created all these.
How can we feel His love for us?
We can realise this by realising our love for others.
We sometimes make many things by ourselves.
We play and make fun with them.
We handle them very carefully, so that they do not get broken or torn.
We keep them carefully after the play.
We take care so that no one can do any harm to them.
Again, some of us draw pictures with colour and brush.
We hung them on the wall so that they donot fall and break down.
If anyone spoils them or say ill of them, we feel very sad.
But when someone praises us, we feel happy for that.
Our parents also make many things with their own hands.
Mother cooks, makes cakes or makes dresses for us.
If anyone speaks ill of their work, they feel sad.
But they feel happy if they are praised.
God has created us.
He has created everything for human beings.
Man is His most favourite creation because He has created them after His own liking.
So He loves human beings more than anything.
God provides with the sunlight equally to all-both good and bad.
His rain falls every where.
Rain falls not on the land of the pious people alone.
It also falls on the land of the impious people.
He knows that we are weak.
Sometimes, we disobey Him.
Yet He loves us.
But He likes to see a change in us.
We come back to Him from the path of sin.
We beg forgiveness to Him.
And He loves to forgive us.
Some times we think, God loves me more than others.
We often feel jealous of others when they are better in their studies.
We also feel envious of others when they play better.
Some times a child thinks that her mother loves other children more.
But parents love all their children equally.
In the same way, God loves all human beings equally.
For He has created all human beings.
All human beings are His children.
How do we know that God loves all men?
In the picture above we see two houses side by side.
But the dwellers of the two houses are not in good terms.
So, they do not visit each other's house.
But God loves them all equally.
When it rains, it rains on both the houses.
By this we can understand, God loves the dwellers of both the houses equally.
If God loves all human beings, why can't we love all?
He, who has created us, has also created others.
As He takes care of us, He takes care of others as well.
So when we speak ill of a person, does not he feel hurt?
Therefore, we should not hate others.
Rather we should love all.
